title: General
content:
General

State Regulations
§ 1262.30 - Fueling prohibited while engine running or being heated
§ 1262.31 - Aircraft and fuel dispensing apparatus to be grounded by wire
§ 1262.32 - Fueling to be conducted at least 50 feet from buildings
§ 1262.33 - Presence of at least two approved fire extinguishers required
§ 1262.34 - Operation of aircraft radio or electrical equipment prohibited
§ 1262.35 - Operation of airborne radar equipment restricted
§ 1262.36 - Presence of passengers, unauthorized persons and smoking prohibited
§ 1262.37 - Care required to prevent fuel overflow
§ 1262.38 - Starting of engines while fuel on ground prohibited
§ 1262.39 - Use of fuel and lubricant facilities restricted
§ 1262.40 - Transfer of bulk fuel within terminal boundaries prohibited
§ 1262.41 - Automotive and ramp equipment refueling restricted
§ 1262.42 - Registration and inspection of tank and refueling service vehicles required
§ 1262.43 - Smoking within 50 feet of tank vehicle prohibited
§ 1262.44 - Delivery of fuel to be under control of attendant
§ 1262.45 - Grounding and bonding of tank and refueling service vehicles required
§ 1262.46 - Fire extinguishers
§ 1262.47 - Parking
§ 1262.48 - Markings
§ 1262.49 - Emergency control devices to be conspicuously marked

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
